intro: Enterosora trichosora, commonly known as the hairy enterosora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to parts of South America and thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
